schemas.description: Cross-language conformance test vector for adapter verification.

schemas.name: sanction-severity
schemas.description: Graduated sanction severity level (v5.1.0). Does not include "terminated" — termination is a separate permanent action, not a graduated severity.

schemas.name: reconciliation-mode
schemas.description: Billing reconciliation mode — determines cost source of truth.

schemas.name: agent-capacity-reservation
schemas.description: Capacity reservation that guarantees an agent a minimum fraction of budget.

schemas.name: reservation-tier
schemas.description: Reserved capacity in basis points (0-10000). 10000 = 100%.

schemas.name: reservation-enforcement
schemas.description: How reservation guarantees are enforced by the provider.

schemas.name: reservation-state
schemas.description: Current lifecycle state of a capacity reservation.

schemas.name: conservation-status
schemas.description: Tristate result of pricing conservation verification.

schemas.name: audit-trail-entry
schemas.description: Bidirectional provenance entry linking completion → billing → conservation status.

schemas.name: governance-config
schemas.description: Protocol governance parameters. Overrides hardcoded defaults when provided.

schemas.name: delegation-chain
schemas.description: Authority delegation chain with depth limits and conservation invariants.

schemas.name: inter-agent-transaction-audit
schemas.description: Protocol-standard audit trail for agent-to-agent economic transactions.

schemas.name: ensemble-capability-profile
schemas.description: Collective capability declaration for model ensembles (patchwork AGI hypothesis).

schemas.name: conservation-property-registry
schemas.description: Registry of conservation invariants with LTL specifications, enforcement classification, and liveness properties (v6.0.0).

schemas.name: jwt-boundary-spec
schemas.description: Cross-system JWT boundary verification protocol specification (6-step pipeline).

schemas.name: outbound-claims
schemas.description: JWT claims for outbound economic requests.

schemas.name: inbound-claims
schemas.description: JWT claims for inbound economic responses with actual cost data.

schemas.name: agent-identity
schemas.description: Canonical agent identity with capability-scoped trust (v6.0.0, BREAKING).

schemas.name: liveness-property
schemas.description: F_t-bounded liveness property with companion safety invariant reference.

schemas.name: timeout-behavior
schemas.description: Action taken when a liveness property timeout expires.

schemas.name: capability-scope
schemas.description: Domain within which a trust level applies (v6.0.0).

schemas.name: capability-scoped-trust
schemas.description: Per-capability-scope trust levels with default fallback (v6.0.0, BREAKING).

schemas.name: constraint-type
schemas.description: Type universe for constraint expression operands (v6.0.0).

schemas.name: constraint-type-signature
schemas.description: Static type signature for a constraint expression (v6.0.0).

schemas.name: bridge-enforcement
schemas.description: How a bridge invariant is enforced: atomically, eventually, or manually.

schemas.name: bridge-invariant
schemas.description: A formally specified invariant for a registry bridge.

schemas.name: exchange-rate-type
schemas.description: How the exchange rate between registries is determined.

schemas.name: exchange-rate-spec
schemas.description: Specification for how exchange rates are determined and maintained.

schemas.name: settlement-policy
schemas.description: How cross-registry transfers are settled.

schemas.name: registry-bridge
schemas.description: A bridge enabling value transfer between two economy registries.

schemas.name: minting-policy
schemas.description: Policy governing token creation within an economy registry.

schemas.name: fork-type
schemas.description: How child delegations are executed: in parallel, sequentially, or conditionally.

schemas.name: tree-node-status
schemas.description: Status of a delegation tree node.

schemas.name: tree-strategy
schemas.description: Strategy for combining results from child delegations.

schemas.name: budget-allocation
schemas.description: How budget is distributed among child delegations.

schemas.name: delegation-tree-node
schemas.description: A node in the delegation tree representing a single agent delegation.

schemas.name: delegation-tree
schemas.description: A tree-structured delegation enabling concurrent multi-model orchestration.

schemas.name: bridge-transfer-saga
schemas.description: A saga orchestrating cross-registry bridge transfer with compensation semantics.

schemas.name: monetary-policy
schemas.description: Monetary policy regime coupling minting to conservation invariants.

schemas.name: delegation-outcome
schemas.description: The outcome of a delegated governance decision with vote and dissent tracking.

schemas.name: permission-boundary
schemas.description: A permission boundary defining MAY semantics for capability-scoped authorization.

schemas.name: governance-proposal
schemas.description: A formal governance proposal with voting lifecycle.

schemas.name: micro-usdc
schemas.description: On-chain USDC amount in micro-units (6 decimal places). String-encoded unsigned bigint.

schemas.description: PersonalityTier

schemas.description: PersonalityAssignment

schemas.name: reputation-credential
schemas.description: ReputationCredential

schemas.name: event-filter
schemas.description: Filter criteria for event subscription. All filters are AND-combined.

schemas.name: delivery-method
schemas.description: Delivery mechanism for subscribed events.

schemas.name: event-cursor
schemas.description: Cursor for event replay and pagination. Specify at most one of after_event_id or after_timestamp.

schemas.name: event-subscription
schemas.description: A subscription to reputation events with filter, delivery, and cursor configuration.

schemas.name: portability-scope
schemas.description: Scope of reputation data to transfer: full (score + state + history), score_only, or state_only.

schemas.name: reputation-portability-request
schemas.description: A request to transfer reputation data between collections.

schemas.name: portability-response
schemas.description: Response to a reputation portability request.

schemas.name: quality-signal-level
schemas.description: Quality signal derived from a delegation outcome. Maps to a numeric score range.

schemas.name: outcome-quality-mapping
schemas.description: Maps each OutcomeType to a QualitySignalLevel. Collections may override defaults.

schemas.name: delegation-quality-event
schemas.description: Event recording a quality signal derived from a delegation outcome, feeding into reputation.

schemas.name: demotion-rule
schemas.description: Rule for time-based reputation state demotion due to inactivity.

schemas.name: reputation-decay-policy
schemas.description: Temporal decay and demotion policy for collection reputation.

schemas.name: collection-governance-config
schemas.description: Per-collection governance configuration for the Bayesian reputation system.

schemas.name: constraint-lifecycle-status
schemas.description: Lifecycle status of a protocol constraint within governance.

schemas.name: constraint-candidate
schemas.description: A constraint candidate proposed for governance enactment.

schemas.name: constraint-lifecycle-event
schemas.description: State transition event in a constraint lifecycle.

schemas.name: routing-signal-type
schemas.description: Type of reputation-based routing signal.

schemas.name: reputation-routing-signal
schemas.description: Reputation-based routing signal for meritocratic resource allocation.

schemas.name: policy-type
schemas.description: Category of versioned policy.

schemas.name: policy-version
schemas.description: Versioned policy record with migration support.
